𓃭 𓄂 𓃬 𒈤 Leo - letter l in the late Egyptian alphabet. wanderwort
𓃮 𓄇 LeoPard panter

Used before Greek times, but not as letter thus less frequent and rather read "Rw" not "Lw"

𓂋 𓏲 𓃭 #rw 𐀩-𐀺 re-wo lion

𓌳 L 1. 𓌳 𓅱 𓃬 лъв ⲗⲁⲃⲟ 𒆷𒁍𒌝 lābum 𐌻𐌰𐌹𐍅𐌰 𐌋𐌄𐌖 Löwe lion < Räuber ܐܪܝܐ ʾaryā a'robber
𓌳 M 2. 𓌳 𓅱 𓃬 Maru mꜣj ⲙⲟⲩⲓ ⲙⲱⲟⲩⲓ ⲙⲟⲩⲉⲓ 𒌨𒈤 maḫu "lion" 𓌳 N 3. 𓌳 𓅱 𓃬 nimrā נִמְרָא 𒉏𒊒 nim-ru leopard 𒌨𒈤 nēšum "lion" 𓌳 SIC 𓌳 𓄿 𓇋 𓃬 ṣecake सिंह sĩh "lion" <> SUKKAL MAḪ 𒈛 𒈤 singa 𓌳 чин čin <> Schnitt 𓌳 SIC 𓌳 𓄿 𓇋 𓃬 shirîkhân™ Schirkan™ शेर śer sher shachal رش shachats 𓌳 <> cut

𒊊 lābu : Löwe, lion, raiona(late) < arïθlan••

𓃭 lion ⲗⲉⲱⲛ лом lom Löwen Löwe лъв ⲗⲁⲃⲟ 𒊊 lābu львъ lĭvŭ 𐌋𐌄𐌖 lev لَيْث layṯ aslan (late) 狸 lí

laMbda: interestingly in Arabic the L strongly carries an M component: ‏الدينة = ‏المدينة
